description: Zero-build, CSS-native utility framework. Single static stylesheet, no processing needed. CSP-compliant, themeable, accessible.

syntax.group_pattern: Add class="group" to parent, use group-hover:* on children
syntax.peer_pattern: Add class="peer" to sibling, use peer-checked:* on following siblings
syntax.has_pattern: Use has-checked:* on parent to style based on descendant state (CSS :has())
syntax.layout_attribute: Use layout="tokens" attribute for structural composition
syntax.standalone_keywords: Some utilities are standalone keywords without prefix: italic, uppercase, underline, truncate, hidden, block, flex, grid, relative, absolute, etc.

spacing_scale.description: Base unit: 0.25rem (4px). Used by padding, margin, gap, width, height, inset, translate, indent, size.

colors.description: Semantic color system. Each primary color has base, hover, active, and subtle variants. Dark theme inverts automatically.
colors.neutrals: neutral-1 (lightest) through neutral-9 (darkest). In dark mode, scale inverts.

shadows.description: Each shadow level auto-sets --_sh-hover to the next level for hover elevation.

available.dark: Inverts all color tokens for dark backgrounds. Also auto-activates via @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark).
available.high-contrast: Extreme contrast ratios. Composable with dark.
available.reduce-motion: Sets all durations to 0ms, pauses animations. Also respects @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce).

layout_attribute.description: Structural composition via the layout HTML attribute. Space-separated tokens.

alignment.description: Compound tokens that set both align-items and justify-content.

responsive.description: Layout attribute supports responsive tokens at all breakpoints.

utilities._note: Complete reference of all utility classes organized by prefix. Use class="prefix:value" in HTML. Standalone classes have no prefix.

display.description: Control element display type. Standalone keywords (no prefix).

object.description: Object fit and position for replaced elements (img, video).
object.note: Fit values set object-fit; position values set object-position.

inset.description: Position offset values. Used with position utilities.
inset.note: Prefix with - for negative values: -top:2 → top: -0.5rem

p.prefix: p / px / py / pt / pb / ps / pe
p.description: Padding. All directions use spacing scale tokens.

m.prefix: m / mx / my / mt / mb / ms / me
m.description: Margin. Supports auto and negative values.

space.description: Space between children using > * + * margin. Alternative to gap.

size.description: Sets both width and height simultaneously.

text.description: Font size. Uses typography scale tokens.

font.description: Font weight AND font family. Prefix is shared — values never overlap (weights are thin/bold/600, families are sans/serif/mono).
font.note: font:bold sets font-weight. font:mono sets font-family. No ambiguity because weight names and family names are distinct sets.

text_decoration.description: Text decoration utilities. Standalone keywords + prefix variants.

bg.description: Background color. Semantic colors (primary, secondary, etc.) auto-set private state variables (--_bg-hover, --_bg-active, --_ring) enabling generic hover:bg, active:bg, and focus:ring to work automatically.
bg.smart_hover: When you use bg:primary and hover:bg together, the hover color is automatically the darker primary-hover shade. No need to specify hover:bg:primary-hover explicitly.

border.description: Border width, color, and style. All share the border: prefix. Values never overlap — numbers are width, color names are color, style names are style.

width.note: border:1 = 1px solid var(--border). Includes solid style and default color.

ring.description: Focus ring using box-shadow. ring:{n} for width, ring:{color} for color.
ring.note: ring:focus is a special utility that applies ring on :focus-visible

shadow.description: Box shadow. Each level auto-sets --_sh-hover to the next level, enabling hover:shadow to auto-elevate.
shadow.smart_hover: shadow:md + hover:shadow → hover shadow becomes shadow-lg automatically.

flex_utilities.prefix: flex / basis / order / justify / items / content / self

grid_utilities.prefix: grid-cols / grid-rows / col-span / col-start / col-end / row-span / row-start / row-end / grid-flow / auto-cols / auto-rows
grid_utilities.description: CSS Grid utilities. Supplements layout attribute.

transforms.negative_note: Prefix with - for negative values: -rotate:45 → rotate(-45deg), -translate-x:4 → translateX(-1rem)

transition.note: transition:colors transitions color, background-color, border-color, fill, stroke simultaneously.

state_variants.description: State variants modify utilities based on element or related element state. Syntax: state:utility (e.g., hover:bg:primary, focus:ring:accent).

generic_states.description: Generic state utilities that read private CSS custom properties. These auto-work with any semantic bg:* or shadow:* utility.
generic_states.hover:bg: Applies --_bg-hover (set automatically by bg:primary, bg:secondary, etc.). Just add hover:bg alongside any semantic background.
generic_states.hover:shadow: Applies --_sh-hover (set automatically by shadow:xs..2xl — each level auto-elevates to next).
generic_states.focus:ring: Applies focus ring using --_ring color (set automatically by semantic backgrounds).
generic_states.usage_example: class="bg:primary hover:bg active:bg focus:ring transition:colors" — full interactive button with zero color configuration.

focus.css: :focus-visible pseudo-class (a11y-compliant — only shows on keyboard navigation)

focus-within.css: :focus-within — triggers when any descendant has focus

disabled.css: :disabled — also sets cursor: not-allowed and pointer-events: none

group.description: Parent-driven state. Add class="group" to a parent element, then use group-hover:* or group-focus:* on child elements to style them based on the parent's state.

peer.description: Sibling-driven state. Add class="peer" to a sibling element (must come BEFORE the target in HTML), then use peer-*:utility on the following sibling. Uses CSS ~ general sibling combinator.
peer.important: The peer element must appear BEFORE the styled element in the HTML source order.

peer-checked.description: Critical for custom checkboxes, toggles, accordions, tabs without JS.

peer-placeholder.description: Style based on whether input has placeholder visible (empty) or has content.

has.description: CSS :has() — style an element based on descendant state. No .group or .peer class needed. Pure CSS. The element itself is styled based on what its descendants are doing.
has.browser_support: Supported in all modern browsers (Chrome 105+, Safari 15.4+, Firefox 121+).

has-checked.description: Style element when it contains a checked checkbox/radio.

has-focus.description: Style element when a descendant has keyboard focus.

has-hover.description: Style element when a descendant is hovered.

has-invalid.description: Style form container when any field is invalid.

responsive.description: Responsive variants use @{breakpoint}: prefix. Mobile-first — styles apply at the breakpoint and above.

layout_attribute_responsive.description: Layout attributes also support responsive tokens: @{bp}:{token}

examples.description: Common UI patterns showing how to compose Baseline CSS utilities. These are the most frequent patterns LLMs should generate.

button_primary.description: Primary CTA button with hover, active, focus states and transition.
button_primary.html: <button class="bg:primary color:white font:semibold text:sm px:4 py:2 rounded:md hover:bg active:bg active:scale:98 focus:ring transition:colors cursor:pointer">Save Changes</button>
button_primary.notes: hover:bg and active:bg auto-use the darker shades. focus:ring auto-uses the bg color.

button_secondary.html: <button class="bg:transparent color:primary border:1 border:primary font:medium text:sm px:4 py:2 rounded:md hover:bg:primary-subtle focus:ring:primary transition:colors cursor:pointer">Cancel</button>

button_danger.html: <button class="bg:danger color:white font:semibold text:sm px:4 py:2 rounded:md hover:bg active:bg active:scale:98 focus:ring transition:colors cursor:pointer">Delete</button>

button_disabled.html: <button class="bg:primary color:white font:semibold text:sm px:4 py:2 rounded:md disabled:opacity:50 transition:colors cursor:pointer" disabled>Submit</button>

has_validation_form.description: Form container that reacts to descendant validity using :has().
has_validation_form.html:
<form class="has-invalid:border:danger has-valid:border:success border:1 rounded:lg p:6 transition:colors">
  <input type="email" class="w:full px:3 py:2 border:1 rounded:md" placeholder="Email" required />
  <button class="mt:4 bg:primary color:white px:4 py:2 rounded:md">Submit</button>
</form>
has_validation_form.note: No JavaScript needed. The form border changes color based on whether its inputs are valid or invalid.

has_checked_card.note: Pure CSS — no JavaScript. Card styles itself when its hidden radio is selected.
